article.title: Triggered massive star formation associated with the bubble HII region Sh2-39 (N5)

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the blue circle in Figure 1 represent?
choices: Position and beam size of the CO(3-2) line observation.
Position and beam size of the CS(2-1) line observation.
Approximate location and size of the stellar cluster [BDS2003]6.
Position and beam size of the H87a and H88a radio recombination line observation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the peak in the averaged spectrum shown in Figure 2 indicate?
choices: Presence of multiple molecular clouds along the line of sight.
Expanding motion of the molecular gas associated with Sh2-39.
Molecular gas concentrated in a single velocity component associated with Sh2-39.
Lack of molecular gas towards the eastern and north-eastern borders of Sh2-39.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the black contours in the bottom right corner of Figure 3i represent?
What is the significance of the horseshoe-shaped structure ("plateau") observed in the radio continuum emission in Figure 4?
choices: It indicates the presence of a supernova remnant.
It represents the radio counterpart of the ionization front and ionized gas of Sh2-39.
It suggests the presence of a strong magnetic field within the nebula.
It shows the distribution of cold dust within the molecular cloud.
